author: MaximoTrinidad
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

On the releases page, I'm looking for the PowerShell Core 6.0 GA version. But, I can't find it. 
So, which of the non-Preview are GA releases.  

Or, should I assume that all non-Preview are actually GA's?

I think this should be address better in the Release Notes.  My organization only support GA release in  their products.

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body:
I agree, it is not very easy to find out as one has to scroll down quite a bit.
The latest GA release is 6.0.2 [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v6.0.2)
Maybe it would be better to display the latest GA always at the very top or at least at 2nd place?
The PowerShell team could also tick the following checkbox so that GitHub marks it as preview:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9250262/42597564-10aa3838-8551-11e8-8539-f4abe0d4e88a.png)

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
@bergmeister 

Yeah! This is one item I would like to add on the next Community Call meeting.  

It would be nice to have a way to display all available GA's from the Preview and properly identified.  This avoid all the scrolling up/down looking for them.

:)

cc @joeyaiello

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: We have links on main page https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell#get-powershell

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
MaximoTrinidad
iSazonov
comments.body: I believe this could be added in release check list.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Is the request about "GA in Release Notes" addressed? Can we close the issue?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I believe this can be closed

title: PSCore - Where is the PowerShell Core GA version(s)?
